paper_abstract: A graph is 1-planar if it can be drawn on the plane so that each edge is crossed by at most one other edge. In this paper, it is proved that every 1-planar graph without adjacent triangles and with maximum degree Delta >= 8 can be edge-colored with Delta colors. (C) 2011 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: On edge colorings of 1-planar graphs without adjacent triangles
